title: Can't connect to chat
body: I'm not sure if this is a Windows 10 problem or a client problem, but I can't connect to chat in the client. My PC just did the "Feature update to Windows 10, version 1607" and then 6.16 patched, so I'm not sure whether one broke the chat or they did it by their powers combined. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!

replies.body:
I'm Also having issues with chat. I haven't been able to connect since the previous patch. After using the guide to forward all the ports I need it still has not fixed the issue. I'm loading a game just now, so i'll have a look at the guide but so far, it doesn't seem good. 

Please Upvote this Thread if you are having similar problems.

Thanks for the detailed post!  Regardless of the update, this sounds like a network issue having problems connecting to our chat servers.  I'd like to start ruling out possibilities by using the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide.  Let me know your results, and be sure to test it out in custom games to prevent any penalties.  I'll be around!

network issue lol i have 20 ms and you think its my network? xD riot are you drunk
Same here, I can't conect but only on EuNe, on EuW it works perfectly.

I'll just copy what i've said in another thread, so everything can be seen here.

> 
> Hey there,
> 
> Same is happening to me. For the first time in 3 years, "Logging onto chat service" is stuck at the bottom of my client.
> 
> I've tried to restart the client, but it won't work any better.
> My ping is stable at 25, and my download rate is, as always, 200MB/s, so I'm pretty much sure it isn't a connection issue.
> 
> Im on OS X El Capitan, v.10.11.6.
>

> [{quoted}](name=Chickenrunnn,realm=EUW,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=weEsrbRh,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-08-16T21:43:48.421+0000)
>
> I'll just copy what i've said in another thread, so everything can be seen here.

Can you check if you have akamai installed ? I think it tries to route the chat to akamai and then fails. I uninstalled it and voila, chat connects.

Have the same problem after the updates. I played the game without any problem today but  now i cannot connect to the chat

Edit: It started to work after a couple of minutes. Idk why

I am using windows 7, and I am having these issues too. can't connect to chat in champ select so I've postponed playing ranked for like forever, until I resolve this issue. <: C

Hey Everyone - 

Below you'll find a list of methods i've tried to sort the "Logging onto chat service..." Problem:

1. Repairing the LoL Client.
2. Uninstalling / Reinstalling the LoL Client.
3. Disabling the Windows Firewalls
4. Disabling my Antivirus (AVAST)
   4.1. Disabling Both Antivirus and Firewalls
5. Forwarding all TCP/UPD Ports required.
6. Staring threateningly at the message displayed.

None of these had worked. However. I noticed my Client had previously had connection issues and turning "IP Helper" off had helped me before.

--
I am aware that Riot have a notice Stating they are having trouble with Chat function.

--

You may wish to try the following:

windows key + r
type in "services.msc" (Hit Enter)
Scorll down to : "ip helper"
Right Click and: Restart (Or Start if it's already turned off)
Shut down your Client and start it up again.


Hope this helps.
Well... same problem since yesterday. Everything worked perfectly until i updated to last patch. No issues in my network connection
Can you check if you have akamai installed ? It is a service that caches internet content and in my case I uninstalled it to make the chat connect normally.
Can't login either since yesterday night! So about 12 hours ago! Never had this issue.

> [{quoted}](name=TrintaE2,realm=EUW,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=weEsrbRh,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2016-08-17T08:09:09.801+0000)
>
> Can't login either since yesterday night! So about 12 hours ago! Never had this issue.

Exactly the same issue. I tried all listed solutions...

I figured out what the problem was on my machine: I use a filtering program called CovenantEyes to (vainly) attempt to protect my small children from the interwebs. I uninstalled it, and it resolved a host of odd connection issues. I'll continue to troubleshoot with them (I suspect there's a conflict with the new Windows push), but hopefully this will help other folks!
